attributes.action: Keep the Trident, Comet and Constellation  at Wroughton for the public viewing
attributes.background: These aircraft should stay on site at Wroughton and not be loaned  be stored outside. There are equivalent airframes in other museums but not in the condition these are in. These are the best examples in the UK if not the world. Wroughton should open to the public for two days a week as a minimum.

rejection.details: Decisions about exhibits and opening times are made by the museum, not the UK Government or Parliament.
